entries.title: 46 Children Were Taken From Ukraine. Many Are Up for Adoption in Russia.
entries.description: The New York Times traced how a web of officials and politicians aligned with President Vladimir V. Putin’s party carried out a campaign to permanently transfer Ukrainian children from Kherson.

category.#text: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

entries.title: Why South African Voters Turned Against the A.N.C.
entries.description: Some South African voters welcomed the defeat of the African National Congress in last week’s elections, even as they remain wary of the country’s political future.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: Elon Musk’s Starlink Connects and Divides Brazil’s Marubo People
entries.description: Elon Musk’s Starlink has connected an isolated tribe to the outside world — and divided it from within.

entries.title: Mexicans Go to Polls in Historic Election, as 2 Women Vie to Lead the Country
entries.description: The voting is very likely to put a woman in the country’s presidency for the first time ever, showcasing the immense strides that females have made in Mexico’s political scene.

entries.title: As Challenges Pile Up, a Spate of Summitry Spotlights Western Resolve
entries.description: Wars in Ukraine and Gaza, along with Donald J. Trump’s candidacy, are testing the Western alliance. But starting with the 80th anniversary of D-Day this week, leaders have a rare opportunity to showcase unity.

entries.title: Why Is North Korea Launching Balloons Carrying Trash?
entries.description: The unusual offensive, across the world’s most heavily fortified border, is a revival of a Cold War era tactic. The South has threatened to respond by blasting K-pop.

entries.title: In Singapore, China Warns U.S. While Zelensky Seeks Support
entries.description: The annual Shangri-La Dialogue became a stage for competing demands on U.S. global power, including the war in Ukraine and tensions over Taiwan.

category.#text: United States Defense and Military Forces

entries.title: Why a Pacific Island Is Blaming China for a Hack
entries.description: Palau’s claims that China orchestrated the attack remain unproven. But it’s clear that the breach presents a danger for another ally of Palau: the United States.

entries.title: Why Mexico May Elect a Female President Before the United States
entries.description: Having a woman as president will be a milestone in a country where gender-based violence is so common. But how much will change remains unclear.

entries.title: India’s Exit Polls Show Modi Is Likely to Win a Third Term as Prime Minister
entries.description: While a newly united opposition seemed to gain some traction, exit polls showed the popular and entrenched prime minister was winning a third term.

entries.title: Real Madrid vs. UEFA Is the Champions League’s Most Bitter Rivalry
entries.description: No club has won European soccer’s richest prize more than Real Madrid, but its recent dominance has been accompanied by a bruising fight over the tournament’s future.

entries.title: South Africa Election: ANC Loses Majority for the First Time in 30 Years
entries.description: The African National Congress received less than 50 percent of the national vote for the first time since gaining power 30 years ago, setting the nation on an uncharted course.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: How Rhubarb Conquered Germany, Then the World
entries.description: A tongue-twisting rap by a Berlin duo has spotlighted Germans’ love of their springtime produce. Now if only they could find a rhyme for asparagus.

entries.title: In the West Bank, Guns and a Locked Gate Signal a Town’s New Residents
entries.description: Since the war in Gaza began, armed Israeli settlers, often accompanied by the army, have stepped up seizures of land long used by Palestinians.

entries.title: China Lands Spacecraft on Far Side of the Moon
entries.description: The landing brings the Chang’e-6 mission a step closer to being the first to return a sample from the part of the moon that’s never seen from Earth.

entries.title: U Tin Oo, Embattled Pro-Democracy Leader in Myanmar, Dies at 97
entries.description: Once one of his country’s most powerful figures, he helped found its main opposition party. “I had to face up to the harm I did to people when I served in the army,” he said.

category.#text: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

entries.title: Robert Pickton, Notorious Canadian Serial Killer, Dies at 74
entries.description: Convicted in the murder of six women (though he boasted of killing many more), he died of unspecified injuries after being assaulted in prison.

entries.title: Protesters in Tel Aviv, Rome and Paris Urge Netanyahu to Accept Cease-Fire Proposal
entries.description: Thousands of demonstrators rallied in Israel on Saturday evening in support of the proposal. Protesters also gathered in Rome, Paris and Jakarta.

entries.title: After Biden’s Push for Truce, Netanyahu Calls Israel’s War Plans Unchanged
entries.description: The timing of the remarks seemed to rebuff the president’s hopes for a speedy end to the war. But some analysts said the prime minister was aiming at domestic supporters, not the White House.

entries.title: Yael Dayan, Israeli Writer, Politician and Daughter of War Hero, Dies at 85
entries.description: She was hailed for her books and admired for promoting women’s rights. But her support for a two-state solution to the Palestinian conflict angered many.

entries.title: It’s June Again
entries.description: Summer returns, and with it all the feelings and fantasies and fears we associate with the season.

entries.title: Warnings of Election Meddling by China Never Reached the Prime Minister
entries.description: A watchdog agency found roadblocks to the flow of information both within the spy agency and the public service.

entries.title: Notre-Dame Rises Again ... in Lego
entries.description: With rose windows, bell towers and a central spire, this model of the famed Paris cathedral is all the hype among adult fans of Lego, known as AFOLs.

entries.title: She’s 98, and Walked Past Corpses to Escape Russian Attacks
entries.description: “If only everything would stop,” said Lidiia Lomikovska, who walked to safety after her town was attacked. But for civilians in the Donetsk region of Ukraine, it is not stopping.

entries.title: Russian Missiles Hit Ukraine’s Energy System, Again
entries.description: The large-scale air assault struck several sites in western Ukraine, including places near the borders with NATO member countries.

entries.title: Scandals and Missteps Slow Momentum of Germany’s Far Right
entries.description: The Alternative for Germany party remains strong, but a growing pushback at home and abroad may be blunting its surge.

entries.title: A Small Army Combating a Flood of Deepfakes in India’s Election
entries.description: Social media is awash with A.I.-altered audio, clipped video and manipulated images. Fact-checkers want to save the public from deception.

entries.title: Deepfake of U.S. Official Appears After Shift on Ukraine Attacks in Russia
entries.description: A manufactured video fabricated comments by the State Department spokesman, Matthew Miller.

entries.title: Six Injured in Stabbing in Germany
entries.description: A police officer and an anti-Islamist activist were among the victims, according to the authorities, who have not released information on a motive.

entries.title: Israel Pushes Deeper Into Rafah, but Gaza Exit Plan Remains Unclear
entries.description: The Israeli military withdrew its forces from the northern town of Jabaliya in Gaza on Friday, leaving behind scenes of devastation, returning residents said.

entries.title: What We Know About Israel’s Cease-Fire Proposal Backed By Biden
entries.description: President Biden outlined a road map put forward by Israel that would begin with an immediate, temporary cease-fire and work toward a permanent end to the war and the reconstruction of Gaza.

entries.title: Nora Cortiñas, 94, a Founder of Argentina’s Mothers of the ‘Disappeared,’ Dies
entries.description: Ms. Cortiñas became a key member of a group of women whose children had been taken by the military dictatorship that led Argentina from 1976 to 1983.

category.#text: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

entries.title: Birubala Rabha, Who Battled Witch Hunting in India, Dies at 75
entries.description: She traveled from village to village in a crusade to stop a practice in which women have been accused of being witches and harshly punished, or even killed, for it.

entries.title: Biden Calls for End to Gaza War, Endorsing Israeli Cease-Fire Proposal
entries.description: The president outlined a plan to try to get Hamas and Israel to break out of a monthslong deadlock that has resulted in the killing of thousands of Palestinians.

entries.title: Palestinians Returning to Jabaliya in Northern Gaza Find Wide Devastation
entries.description: “The destruction is indescribable,” said Mohammad Awais, who returned with his family to their home on Friday.

entries.title: Blinken Hints U.S. May Allow Ukraine Greater Latitude to Strike in Russia
entries.description: The U.S. secretary of state suggested that Ukraine’s use of American-supplied arms could expand beyond the current limitation to strikes in the Kharkiv area.

entries.title: Greece Is Betting Big on Liquefied Natural Gas From the U.S.
entries.description: Even as it pivots to solar and wind for itself, Greece aims to become a natural gas supplier across Europe. Among its strongest backers is the United States.

entries.title: Champions League: Borussia Dortmund Shows Anything Is Possible
entries.description: Can an underdog still have its day in the Champions League? The sport should hope so.

entries.title: The Weapons That Ukraine Might Use to Shoot Into Russia
entries.description: Decisions by President Biden and others give Ukrainian forces several new options. But they’re still restricted in the use of Western missiles that could strike far inside Russia.

entries.title: India and Pakistan Heat Wave Is a Matter of Survival for Laborers
entries.description: Pakistan and India are sweltering. For laborers, not working because of the extreme temperatures can mean not eating.

entries.title: After Trump’s Conviction, a Wary World Waits for the Fallout
entries.description: Already braced for uncertainty about the U.S. election, countries in Europe and Asia are now even more unclear about the future of American diplomacy.

category.#text: New York State Criminal Case Against Trump (71543-23)

entries.title: For Women Mountain Climbers, Dangers Go Beyond Avalanches and Storms
entries.description: Women are increasingly reporting sexual harassment and abuse in the sport, including accusations against the renowned climber Nirmal Purja.

entries.title: Ukraine Buoyed by Biden’s Move on Using Weapons to Strike Russia
entries.description: After weeks of entreaties, Ukraine won permission to hit targets inside Russia with American-made weapons, a tactic that it says will help it defend territory in the northeast.

entries.title: U.S., Chinese Defense Chiefs Hold First in-Person Talks Since 2022
entries.description: Speaking in Singapore, Lloyd J. Austin III sought to reassure allies and put China on notice that Ukraine and the Mideast were not distracting the U.S. from this focus.

category.#text: United States Defense and Military Forces
Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: Why I Love the Sydney Opera House
entries.description: The art is accessible, the attendees cut across the social spectrum and the architecture beguiles.

entries.title: Friday Briefing
entries.description: Good morning. We’re covering the verdict in Donald Trump’s criminal trial and U.S. permission for Ukraine to use American weapons inside Russia.

entries.title: Slovakia’s Prime Minister, Robert Fico, Leaves Hospital
entries.description: Prime Minister Robert Fico had been shot during a meeting with supporters. The hospital’s director told a TV station Mr. Fico could continue treatment at home.

entries.title: Egypt Faces Hard Choices After Israeli Seizure of Gaza’s Southern Border
entries.description: Egypt’s government is weighing its “cornerstone” relationship with Israel against the economic damage the war in Gaza is inflicting and against the domestic outrage over the devastation there.

entries.title: Under Pressure, Biden Allows Ukraine to Use U.S. Weapons to Strike Inside Russia
entries.description: White House officials said the president’s major policy shift extended only to what they characterized as acts of self-defense so that Ukraine could protect Kharkiv, its second-largest city.

entries.title: Ukrainian Drone Strikes Target Russian Nuclear Radar Stations
entries.description: A radar facility more than 1,100 miles into Russia was damaged, satellite imagery showed. The attacks have drawn concern from U.S. officials.

entries.title: Why Israel Seized the Philadelphi Corridor
entries.description: An eight-mile-long strip of land between the Gaza Strip and Egypt is the latest focus of the Israeli assault on Hamas.

entries.title: Taking the Fight to Russia: The West Weighs Ukraine’s Use of Its Weapons
entries.description: More NATO allies are backing Kyiv’s pleas to allow its forces to conduct strikes in Russian territory with Western weapons.

entries.title: South Africans Turn Away from ANC in Early Election Results
entries.description: As votes trickled in, the power and influence of the African National Congress, which has led the country for 30 years, appeared to be waning.

entries.title: OpenAI Says Russia and China Used Its A.I. in Covert Campaigns
entries.description: Iran and an Israeli company also exploited the tools in online influence efforts, but none gained much traction, an OpenAI report said.

entries.title: After Cyberattack, Christie’s Gives Details of Hacked Client Data
entries.description: Its disclosure came after RansomHub claimed responsibility for the cyberattack and threatened to release client data on the dark web.

entries.title: Ukraine Warns of Deepening Russian Threat in the North
entries.description: Analysts say an offensive in the Kharkiv or Sumy regions could stretch Ukrainian troops to the breaking point and allow Moscow to punch through.

entries.title: Spain Approves Amnesty Law on 2017 Catalan Independence Referendum
entries.description: The measure has divided Spain in recent months, and opponents vowed to keep trying to block it.

entries.title: John Lennon’s Guitar From ‘Help!’ Is Sold for $2.9 Million at Auction
entries.description: After appearing in multiple albums by the Beatles, the instrument was forgotten for more than 50 years before it turned up in the attic of a British countryside home.

entries.title: After Floods, Brazil Has a Surge in Homeless Pets
entries.description: Officials in the southern part of the country have rescued more than 12,500 animals in recent weeks since catastrophic floods inundated cities and towns.

entries.title: Mexicans Are on the Verge of Electing Their First Female President
entries.description: Claudia Sheinbaum is the front-runner in Mexico’s presidential race, but she is wrestling with the image that she could be a pawn of the current president.

entries.title: Millions of Indians Living Abroad Have a Say in the Election, Even if They Can’t Vote
entries.description: The number of Indians abroad is small relative to the country’s population. Indian political parties want their support anyway.

entries.title: ‘Not Everything Was Bad’: Saluting the Mercedes of Eastern Europe and a Communist Past
entries.description: A festival of classic cars from the communist era brings out some nostalgia in eastern Germany for pre-unification days, although the abuses that occurred behind the Iron Curtain aren’t forgotten.
